revised_title: Discovery of a Canal in the Medulla Spinalis of Quadrupeds
tldr: The author, William Sewell, discovers a canal in the medulla spinalis of various quadrupeds and investigates its structure and function. He finds that the canal is lined with a membrane resembling the tunica arachnoidea and is filled with a transparent, colorless fluid. Sewell also demonstrates that the canal provides a continuous pathway from one end of the spinal cord to the other, allowing for communication between the brain and spinal cord.
